question: The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) was constituted under which of the following Acts?
option1: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Cess Act, 1977
option2: Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981
option3: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974
answer: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974
explanation: The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) was constituted under Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974 in September, 1974. It is a statutory organisation. CPCB was given the powers and functions under the Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act of 1981.
